text: we had an update from the hospital this
morning here in Israel we're not
expecting I think to hear more unless
there is a real change in the condition
of Ariel Sharon clearly that condition
remains very serious he's been in a coma
for almost exactly 8 years to the day we
understand that in recent days his
condition within that coma it's been
deteriorating family are gathered at the
bedside we understand there have been
discussions about what kind of medical
intervention may or may not be possible
we've been told by a very senior doctor
from the hospital where he's being
treated that his life is in danger but
when he was asked about speculation in
the Israeli media that perhaps that life
expectancy could now be measured in days
or even hours the doctor said look I'm
not a prophet no one can count his days
so really we can't be anything more any
more specific than that we know that
Ariel Sharon within that state of coma
is very seriously ill his body is
deteriorating but what the next few
hours and days will hold for him we
really can't say so Kevin everyone
watching very closely obviously can you
remind us how he is viewed in Israel how
narrow Sharon's I mean a figure of
enormous significance in Israeli society
in Israeli history its career dates back
right to the foundation of the state in
1948 he fought in the Israeli war of
independence he was a soldier for many
years he fought in all of Israel's
crucial Wars of what Israelis regard as
national survival in 1967 and 1973 he
was a very senior and significant
commander in those Wars a national hero
if you like and he took that authority
from that military career into politics
it was always a controversial figure
here not all Israeli supported his
political positions of course they
didn't and he was able to use his
authority as that he built up in a life
of soldiering to push through some
pretty difficult decisions in his rare
like the withdrawal from gaza in 2005 so
you've never afraid to make difficult
decisions I think it's fair to say
although sometimes a rather awkward
thing to say at moments like this that
arrow charan was hated
by Israel's Arab enemies throughout the
course of much of his life and was seen
as a very controversial figure
throughout the Middle East those
Israelis who loved Ariel Sharon who
still love him now of course he is still
alive they would argue that the extent
to which he was hated in the Arab world
as perhaps a measure of the contribution
he made it Israel security through its
many crises over the last decades
